body_html:
@WenmuZhou : The performance guide is now published at https://www.tensorflow.org/performance/performance_guide#rnn_performance - do take a look there. It depends on your model needs, but if you can use CudnnRNN, you should do so.

We are working to make this easier in the future, but till then do see the recommendations in the guide linked to above.
(FYI @drpngx )
